Accessing localhost on a VirtualBox VM

02 Jan 2016

There are a number of great ways to test your web projects against the growing number of browsers and mobile devices. Lately, I have found myself using BrowserStack. It’s reasonably priced, easy to use, and has a large range of browsers and devices available.

However, for Internet Explorer testing, I find myself going back to the virtual machines that are provided by the team at Modern.ie. They take a little bit of time to download and get installed, but the fantastic ievms project makes the download and setup super simple if you are handy with the command line.

One thing that trips me up once I get the environment set up, is how to actually look at my local site in the IE browser that I have loaded in the virtual environment. Unfortunately, it isn’t as simple as just typing in http://localhost:3000 or using your local machine’s IP address. To view a site running on localhost, you can simply use http://10.0.2.2:3000 and that will map back to localhost on your local machine.

I am mainly writing this down because it trips me up every time. Hopefully, it saves other people time and frustration as well.
